data.title: Voegelin (Eric) papers
data.text:
The Philosophy of Order: Essays on History, Consciousness and Politics, For Eric Voegelin on His Eightieth Birthday, Edited by Peter J. Opitz and Gregor Sebba 1981 January 3

Bibliography; contents table; reviews by Dante Germino, Thomas Langan, and Johannes Hampel; address list for the Tabula Gratulatoria; and correspondence with Peter J. Opitz and Gregor Sebba

Reviews of The Soul of the State (or The Know Thyself)and of Peter Trisca, Prolégomènes à une mécanique sociale, Archiv für Sozialwissenschaft und Sozialpolitik 1923

Scope and Contents note

Printed copy

Reviews of Albert Muntsch and Henry S. Spalding, Introductory Sociologyand of Frank Hamilton Hankins, An Introduction to the Study of Sociology 1929

Scope and Contents note

Typescript

Review of E. Jordan, Theory of Legislation: An Essay on the Dynamics of Public Mind, Nationalwirtschaft, 1930

Scope and Contents note

Holograph, typescript, galley proofs, and printed copy

Review of A. Zimmern, Nationality and Governmentand The Prospects of Democracy, Zeitschrift für öffentliches Recht 1934

Scope and Contents note

Typescript and galley proofs

Letter, dated 29 October 1935, by an unidentified high government official to the President of Austria, relating to several points of constitutional order raised by Eric Voegelin in the book 1935

"The Change in the Ideas on Government and Constitution in Austria since 1918," 1937 April

Scope and Contents note

Third of three memoranda submitted to the International Studies Conference on Peaceful Change, Tenth session, Paris, France, 28 June-3 July 1937. Research material, typescript, and mimeographed copy. Includes memoranda of Otto Brunner and Gregor Sebba

Review of James Brown Scott, The Law, The State, and the International Community, The Review of Politics 1941

Scope and Contents note

Holograph, typescript, and letter from Waldemar Gurian

Review of Ernst Fraenkel, The Dual State: A Contribution to the Theory of Dictatorship, The Journal of Politics 1942

Scope and Contents note

Typescript

Review of Marvin Farber, The Foundation of Phenomenology: Edmund Husserl and the Quest for a Rigorous Science of Philosophy 1943

Scope and Contents note

Holograph, typescript, and correspondence with Leo Strauss and Marvin Farber

Review of John H. Hallowell, The Decline of Liberalism as an Ideology, with Particular References to German Political Thought, The Journal of Politics 1944

Scope and Contents note

Holograph, typescript, and correspondence with Robert S. Rankin

Review of Hans Kelsen, General Theory of Law and State and of William Ebenstein, The Pure Theory of Law circa 1945

Scope and Contents note

Typescript

Review of F. S. C. Northrop, The Meeting of East and West: An Inquiry Concerning World Understanding circa 1947

Scope and Contents note

Typescript and letter to Leo Strauss

Review of John Wild, Plato's Modern Enemies and the Theory of Natural Lawand of Ronald B. Levinson, In Defense of Plato, American Political Science Review 1954

Scope and Contents note

Typescript and letter to Emmette S. Redford

English translation (Russell Nieli, assisted by Paul Caringella, Thomas Hollweck, and Wolfgang Mann) entitled "The German University and the Order of German Society: A Reconsideration of the Nazi Era," The Intercollegiate Review 1985 Spring/Summer

Typescript of chapter 1 ("Remembrance of Things Past," a new essay which replaced the foreword) and chapter 3

Includes correspondence with Gerhart Niemeyer

"The Hope of the Gospels and the Hope of Culture," 1970 February 26

Notes, outline, and transcript

Speech, University of Notre Dame, South Bend, Indiana. Outline

"The Beyond and Its Parousia," 1982 October 15
